page.title: 10ULNABY HALL FARM-CONTINUED
page.content: One problem with using machinery is compaction of the heavy clayey soil. Most of the land is artificially drained, originally with clay tiles and more recently with plastic piping. {E.E.C.}grants have helped with this, and also with buildings and other improvements. The farm is worked by the tenant and his two sons and one{employee}who lives on the farm. Because the farm is beyond the{urban {fringe}of Darlington there are no problems with vandalism or the encroachment of building developments. Some farms nearer the town have developed "Pick Your Own" businesses,but Ulnaby Hall is too far away to benefit from this. The farm's main income is from potatoes,but other crops vary in profitability according to E.E.C.
